events.originalText: Second Nagorno-Karabakh War: Azerbaijani forces defeated the self-proclaimed Republic of Artsakh in the Battle of Shusha, reclaiming the town after 28 years.
events.subtitle: Second Nagorno-Karabakh War
events.headline: Azerbaijani forces defeat Republic of Artsakh in Battle of Shusha

events.originalText: Israeli artillery shelled a row of houses in the Gaza Strip town of Beit Hanoun, killing at least 19 Palestinians and wounding more than 40 others.
events.subtitle: 2006 shelling of Beit Hanoun
events.headline: Israeli artillery shells houses in Beit Hanoun, killing 19 Palestinians

events.originalText: A Provisional Irish Republican Army bomb exploded during a Remembrance Sunday ceremony in Enniskillen, Northern Ireland, killing 12 people and injuring 63 others.
events.subtitle: Provisional Irish Republican Army
events.headline: IRA bomb kills 12 in Enniskillen during Remembrance Sunday ceremony

events.originalText: British peer Lord Lucan disappeared without a trace, a day after allegedly murdering his children's nanny Sandra Rivett.
events.subtitle: John Bingham, 7th Earl of Lucan
events.headline: Lord Lucan disappears after alleged murder of nanny Sandra Rivett

events.originalText: English rock group Led Zeppelin released their fourth album, which became one of the best-selling albums worldwide.
events.subtitle: Led Zeppelin
events.headline: Led Zeppelin releases fourth album, becomes best-selling worldwide

events.originalText: Former Massachusetts attorney general Edward Brooke became the first African American elected to the United States Senate since Reconstruction.
events.subtitle: Massachusetts
events.headline: Edward Brooke elected first African American to US Senate since Reconstruction

events.originalText: Vietnam War: In the Battle of Gang Toi, one of the earliest battles between the two sides, Viet Cong forces repelled an Australian attack.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: Viet Cong forces repel Australian attack in Battle of Gang Toi

events.originalText: En route from San Francisco to Honolulu, Pan Am Flight 7 crashed into the Pacific Ocean due to unknown causes, killing all 44 people on board.
events.subtitle: Pan Am Flight 7
events.headline: Pan Am Flight 7 crashes into Pacific Ocean, killing all 44 on board

events.originalText: The Italian invasion of Greece failed as outnumbered Greek units repulsed the Italians at the Battle of Elaia–Kalamas.
events.subtitle: Greco-Italian War
events.headline: Italian invasion of Greece fails at Battle of Elaia-Kalamas

events.originalText: The Australian military withdrew from their "war against emus" in Western Australia, due to negative press coverage of the operation.
events.subtitle: Australian Defence Force
events.headline: Australian military withdraws from 'war against emus' in Western Australia

events.originalText: The Shunzhi Emperor (portrait shown), the third emperor of the Qing dynasty, was enthroned in Beijing after the collapse of the Ming dynasty as the first Qing emperor to rule over China.
events.subtitle: Shunzhi Emperor
events.headline: Shunzhi Emperor enthroned in Beijing as first Qing emperor of China

events.originalText: Following a successful invasion of Sweden by Danish forces under Christian II, scores of Swedish leaders in Stockholm were imprisoned and later executed despite Christian's promise of general amnesty.
events.subtitle: Christian II of Denmark
events.headline: Danish forces invade Sweden, imprison and execute Swedish leaders

events.originalText: A law was passed that confined most of Venice's glassmaking industry to nearby Murano.
events.subtitle: Venetian glass
events.headline: Law confines Venice's glassmaking industry to Murano

events.originalText: Trần Thánh Tông, the second emperor of Vietnam's Trần dynasty, took up the title of retired emperor, but continued to co-rule with his son Nhân Tông (pictured) for eleven more years.
events.subtitle: Trần Thánh Tông
events.headline: Trần Thánh Tông takes up title of retired emperor in Vietnam

events.originalText: Arab–Byzantine wars: Having been the target of many raids by the Emirate of Aleppo, Byzantine forces led by Leo Phokas the Younger ambushed the Hamdanids and annihilated their army.
events.subtitle: Arab–Byzantine wars
events.headline: Byzantine forces ambush and annihilate Hamdanid army in Arab-Byzantine wars
